svg.content: <mxfile host="app.diagrams.net" modified="2023-06-25T06:15:20.738Z" agent="Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/114.0.0.0 Safari/537.36" etag="i_p1iUc4vkJdOc3CfjPD" version="21.3.8" type="device" pages="2"><diagram name="Internet mind map" id="YQ4aixg21iMdSrSpkp9l"></diagram><diagram id="gvzQqeRAyauMD6iBT_0H" name="Computer Network"></diagram></mxfile>

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 378px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1166px; margin-left: 32px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.font: A metropolitan area network (MAN) is a computer network that is larger than a single building local area network (LAN) but is located in a single geographic area that is smaller than a wide area network (WAN).

switch.text: A metropolitan area network (MAN) is a computer network that is...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 348px; height: 1px; padding-top: 740px; margin-left: 907px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 471px; height: 1px; padding-top: 99px; margin-left: 1575px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.font: A computer network is a group of interconnected nodes or computing devices that exchange data and resources with each other. A network connection between these devices can be established using cable or wireless media.

switch.text: A computer network is a group of interconnected nodes or computing devices that...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 276px; height: 1px; padding-top: 94px; margin-left: 12px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.font: Network topology is the physical and logical arrangement of nodes and connections in a network. Nodes usually include devices such as switches, routers and software with switch and router features.

switch.text: Network topology is the physical and logical arrangement of nodes a...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 358px; height: 1px; padding-top: 885px; margin-left: 2px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.font: A Local Area Network (LAN) is a network that is confined to a relatively small area. It is generally limited to a geographic area such as a writing lab, school, or building.

switch.text: A Local Area Network (LAN) is a network that is confined to...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 399px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1381px; margin-left: 444px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.font: Wide Area Networks (WANs) connect networks in larger geographic areas, such as Bengaluru, India or the world. Dedicated transoceanic cabling or satellite uplinks may be used to connect this type of global network.

switch.text: Wide Area Networks (WANs) connect networks in larger geographic are...

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.font: Routers guide and direct network data, using packets that contain various kinds of data—such as files, communications, and simple transmissions like web interactions.

switch.text: Routers guide and direct network data, using packets that cont...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 234px; height: 1px; padding-top: 952px; margin-left: 1020px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.font: Networking hardware facilitates seamless communication and connectivity in a network. Each networking equipment performs a specific function or role in a network and its segments.

switch.text: Networking hardware facilitates seamless communication and con...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 419px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1428px; margin-left: 1009px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.font: Modem connects you to the Internet. Think of a modem as a translator that allows devices like computers, switches, or routers to connect to the Internet by interpreting signals from an Internet Service Provider (ISP).

switch.text: Modem connects you to the Internet. Think of a modem as a translator t...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 173px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1221px; margin-left: 1040px;

div.span: Network gateway is a network node used in telecommunications that connects two networks with different transmission protocols together. Gateways serve as an entry and exit point for a network.

switch.text: Network gateway is a network node used in telecommunications th...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 378px; height: 1px; padding-top: 846px; margin-left: 1822px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.font: A repeater is a network device that retransmits a received signal with more power and to an extended geographical or topological network boundary than what would be capable with the original signal.

switch.text: A repeater is a network device that retransmits a received sign...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 450px; height: 1px; padding-top: 534px; margin-left: 1739px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.font: Network switch connects devices in a network to each other, enabling them to talk by exchanging data packets. Switches can be hardware devices that manage physical networks or software-based virtual devices.

switch.text: Network switch connects devices in a network to each other, enabling them t...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 404px; height: 1px; padding-top: 430px; margin-left: 1236px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: none; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.font: Network hub is a node that broadcasts data to every computer or Ethernet-based device connected to it. A hub is less sophisticated than a switch, the latter of which can isolate data transmissions to specific devices.

switch.text: Network hub is a node that broadcasts data to every computer or Ethe...
